Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Bombinin H3 (XXD, XXA; natural AMPs; UCLL1c; toad, amphibians, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: C-terminal NH2; Note that the abundance of amino acid at position 1 is Leu (31%) and Ile (69%). To distiguish it from Bombinin H1, L is used at position 1. Moreover, position 2 is a D-amino acid (X=D-alloisoleucine) represented by I.Activity: Active against E. coli D21(LC 3.7 uM) and S. aureus Cowan 1 (LC 2.4 uM).Toxicity:  highly Hemolytic (Lethal concentration 15.7 uM). Updated 9/2020; 11/2023
Literature Information.Author: Mignogna G, Simmaco M, Kreil G, Barra D.1993
Literature Information.Title: Antibacterial and haemolytic peptides containing D-alloisoleucine from the skin of Bombina variegata
